Class OptionsParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • OptionsParser

  • public class OptionsParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class Parses arguments from command line, checks their correctnes and use proper functions based on input.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OptionsParser() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void option1(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method represents first functionality of program- it finds AirIndex of given MeasureStation
      void option2(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method represents second functionality of program- it finds given parameter's and date's value
      void option3(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void option4(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method represents 4th functionality of program- it finds parameter which had highest fluctuations in given time period
      void option5(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method represents 5th functionality of program- it finds lowest value amomng all stations and parameters
      void option6(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method represents 6th functionality of program- it finds find N sensors and values which exceeded pollution's staandards
      void option7(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method represents 7th functionality of program- it finds given parameter's highest and lowest values and corresponding stations
      void option8(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method represents 8th functionality of program- it draws a Chart for given parameters, stations and period of time
      void parseOptions(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method parses options from command line, when there are no arguments it shows help
      java.lang.String reDate(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String hour)
      This method converts two String from output to one String in proper date format

      • parseOptions

        public void parseOptions(java.lang.String[] args)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method parses options from command line, when there are no arguments it shows help
        Parameters:
        args - String array containing user's input
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when given arguments doesn't match to parser's options
